alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 19 at 3:47PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Yukon River from Grayling to Russian Mission * WHEN...Through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...A large ice jam upriver from Grayling will release a significant volume of water when the ice jam breaks. Residents in Grayling, Anvik, Holy Cross, and Russian Mission will see a rapid rise in water levels when the ice jam releases. Water levels may rise to bankfull in some locations along with bank to bank runs of ice moving downriver. It is possible additional ice jams may form and result in flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The NWS is continuing to monitor an jam on the Yukon River located approximately 7 miles upriver from Grayling. The Yukon River is flowing overbank upriver from the ice jam for nearly 70 miles and flooding low lying areas east of the river.
info.instruction: Residents are encouraged to monitor water levels as the breakup front moves through this reach of the Yukon River and move items near the riverbank to higher ground.
